main event: A balloon approximately 50 ft in diameter and 200 ft long was observed in Tanana, Alaska on 12 Feb 50. The balloon was shot down but not yet recovered.
interesting points: The balloon was box-shaped and had a dimension of 35' longer from top to bottom.
One side of the balloon appeared to have a mirror-bright surface, and it appeared to change shape at times.
Y-shaped objects arrived in the area, and one such object caused the balloon to collapse and descend rapidly.
The altitude of the object was estimated to be between 25,000 and 30,000 feet.
The source of the balloon and equipment could not be determined until recovery.
result: Likely explained as a balloon, but the source and purpose remained unknown until recovery.
sighted object: A balloon approximately 50 ft in diameter and 200 ft long
witnesses: Crew 11, LTLT track 12 FND VF-85 Air Division
